page.title: 19FARMING - PART ONE
page.content: The main land cover in the district is grassland with some small areas of woodland.There are 16 farms averaging about 150 acres each.These are mainly mixed dairy and beef farms where the main enterprise is in milk production and crossbred cattle from the dairy herd.Food for the herd is based on early cut silage in May followed by a hay crop in July and further silage in July or August. The predominant grain crop is barley which grows well on land which is undulating between 200 and 300 feet above sea level.
